page.title: 04INDUSTRY IN BURTON PIDSEA
page.content: THE HOLDERNESS PLOUGH COMPANY The Holderness Plough Company is a firm of Agricultural Suppliers, now owned by the Elswick-Hopper Company of Lincolnshire. It employs eleven people. Originally one of the village blacksmith's, they later began to make ploughs. The owner at that time was called Stamford and he made a plough specially for the Holderness area. It became well known as the Holderness Plough, and so did the company. After the Industrial Revolution, they became agents for making and repairing all kinds of farm machinery. They now act as agents for tractor companies from all over the world. Nowadays, they only make small items such as storage bins, pipes and wrought iron gates.
